alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 3:17AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Camden, northwestern Gloucester, southern Philadelphia and southeastern Delaware Counties through 345 AM EDT... At 316 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Philadelphia International Arpt, or 11 miles west of Gloucester City, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Camden, Gloucester City, Cherry Hill, Chester, Deptford, West Deptford, Lindenwold, Bellmawr, Yeadon, Woodbury, Palmyra, Folcroft, Swarthmore and Paulsboro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
